$eref.description: Describes a rule, which consists of zero or more conditions that must be evaluated to true in order to trigger the one or more actions
$eref.title: Rule schema.

_88inside-condition.description: Geo-fence: check whether the updated feature, or the feature with ID featureId, is inside the area.

___polyId.description: ID of the feature that represents the polygon area (geo-fence).

___featureId.description: ID of the feature that must be checked whether it is inside the area.

___static.description: When true, the polygon ID represents a static area, resulting in slightly optimized code.

_88nearby-condition.description: Check whether the updated feature is near the point.

___units.description: Specifies the unit type in which the distance is measured.

___locationLatLng.description: Specifies the reference location in latitude and longitude.

___distance.description: Distance to the reference location in units

___static.description: When true, the polygon ID represents a static area, resulting in slightly optimized code.

___locationId.description: ID of the feature that represents the reference point.

oneOf.description: Attach either the complete feature, its properties or geometry to the message.
Alternatively, you can also provide an attached object.

___message.description: Message to show in the client.

___method.description: Name of the method to execute at the receiver.

___publisher.description: The publisher type - may be superfluous after renaming the method to sendImbMessage.

_88evaluate-condition.description: Evaluate the properties, e.g. speed > 5. Note that we only support one level of brackets.

___description.description: Description of the rule's purpose. Solely used for documentation purposes.
___description.title: Description schema.

___recurrence.description: How often may the rule fire. In case the value is -1, fire continuously.
___recurrence.title: Recurrence schema.

___activationType.description: Determines when the rule should be activated / triggered.

___actions.description: An array of actions: each action is executed when the rule is triggered.
___actions.title: Actions schema.

___delayInMSec.description: Delay in milliseconds before triggering the action.

___activatedAt.description: The time the rule is activated.

___conditions.description: An array of AND conditions: each condition must be evaluated to true in order to trigger the actions in the rule.
___conditions.title: Conditions schema.

___featureId.description: Feature (ID) this rule applies too. If the featureId is specified, the rule is not generic.

___isGeneric.description: If true, indicates that we are dealing with a rule that is not bound to a specific feature, but applied to all.

___isActive.description: A rule may start active, meaning it will be evaluated every time, or inactive, waiting for activation to occur.
___isActive.title: IsActive schema.

$eref.description: Specifies how to describe an external source.
$eref.title: Subscriber schema.

___refreshIntervalMSec.description: Interval in milliseconds to refresh the source.
___refreshIntervalMSec.title: RefreshIntervalMSec schema.

___referenceId.description: Which property should we use to name the feature.
___referenceId.title: ReferenceId schema.

___path.description: Full path to the source (may include port number)
___path.title: Path schema.

$eref.description: Specifies how to import GeoJSON files as namespaces.
$eref.title: Schema for importing GeoJSON.

___referenceId.description: Specifies which of the feature properties in the GeoJSON file should be used as ID.
___referenceId.title: ReferenceId schema.

___path.description: Relative or absolute path to the GeoJSON file.
___path.title: Path schema.

___id.description: Optional ID of this publisher in a network.
___id.title: Id schema.
